moves.2. e3: Opens the diagonal for Bishop at f1
moves.3... Bg4: Upsets white development by forcing Be2 or Nf3 to defend the Queen
moves.4. Nf3: Dunst Opening and Pinning the knight to Queen
moves.5. h4: Be2 would been better, would released knight from pin.
moves.5... Bd6: Clears way for castling and attacks f4.
moves.6. Bd3: allows the short castle and attacks h7.
moves.6... Nc6: Develops the knight and attacks e5 and d4
moves.8. a4: white seems to be trying to create space on Queen side
moves.9. b3: Opening up on Queenside but whites as 3 blackward pawns
moves.9... d4: Black uses a lever move d4 to attack white pawn chain and creating isolated pawn at f4. Slighty better is Ng3
moves.10. exd4: Hangs pawn at f4. Better is Ne4
moves.10... Bxf4: Computer analysis calls Bxf4 a serious miscue by black and better is Nxd4 whichs leads to Qe1 and Nxf3  which forks King and Queen and easily resolved by Rxf3. I was playing for attack on h2.
moves.12. Qe1: Releases white knight from the pin
moves.12... Qf6: Computer Alanysis Qf6 is mistake and Better is Qxd4
moves.13. b4: Blocks Bishop at a3 and better is Ne4
moves.13... Bxf3: Attacks pawn at d4 with two pieces
moves.15. Rf2: Hangs pawn at h4 and better is Rh3
moves.15... Qxh4: Frees bishop from pin and isolates pawn at g2
moves.16. Ne4: Allows black a forcd mate oportunity and better is Rxf4
moves.16... Qh2+: Leads to forced move Kf1 and mate on h1.
